title: Did countries use WWI as an excuse to invade other countries and continue imperialism within their own continent? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not in general as the question is phrased, except perhaps for the acquisition of the German colonies of South-West Africa, New Guinea and Samoa by South Africa, Australia and New Zealand respectively. Britain, France, Italy and Belgium all acquired former German colonies as League of Nations mandates, but not in Europe. Britain and France used the entry of the Ottoman Empire into the war to acquire vast swathes of territory. These weren’t war aims of either country in 1914, but emerged as the war went on. These war aims were secondary to the primary war aim of defeating and weakening Germany, but were certainly Imperialistic.

Yes of course….. have a look at the US War Plan Black, the hidden original version of 1910, not the always published updated WW1 version if 1916 ….. and compare it to the treaty of Versailles. Exactly mission accomplished… and do not forget the Lusitania fraud, being used to transport militarical goods und than beeing misused as the reason to step into the war and help to fullfill War Plan Black in it' s inital version.
